movies.title: Ave Maria
movies.plot: An opera singer has had one great love in his life, that for a devoted french-girl who died. He comes to Paris for his annual visit to her grave on the anniversary of her death, but is forced to go through with a concert his manager had arranged without his knowledge. The manager visits a shady night club and, while intoxicated, drops information to a hard-boiled entertainer and her gigolo of the singers' great sorrow and wealth. The wealth part impresses the pair. The girl meets and accompanies the singer to Naples, after playing on his sympathies with lies and deception. The singer and the girl announce their engagement, but he discovers her duplicity and she, now genuinely in love with him, flees the consequences. She is injured in an automobile accident and the singer, having learned of her repentance and true affectation for him, takes her for his bride.
movies.simplePlot: An opera singer has had one great love in his life, that for a devoted french-girl who died. He comes to Paris for his annual visit to her grave on the anniversary of her death, but is ...

biography.bio: Beniamino Gigli was born in Recanati, Italy, on March 20, 1890, into a poor family. He possessed a fine singing voice and, after struggling to make a living for many years, he eventually made his operatic debut as a tenor on October 15, 1914, appearing in "La Giaconda" in Rovigo, Italy. Over the following years his reputation and stature grew. His first recordings were issued in 1918, and he was invited to sing at the Metropolitan Opera House in New York in 1920, where the greatest singers of the time performed. He appeared there every year for the next 12 seasons until 1932; he got into a wage dispute with the management and, even though it was in the middle of the Great Depression, he quit and left to return to Europe. During the 1920s and 1930s he was often called the World's Greatest Tenor and Enrico Caruso's successor. He began touring and performing all around the world, on the way becoming an especial favorite of Nazi leader Adolf Hitler, Italian dictator Benito Mussolini and their cliques. His autobiography, like many, can touch around subjects that are very sensitive to its author, and his was somewhat reticent regarding his ties to Hitler and Mussolini, but overall it showed him to be human and as capable of making mistakes as anyone else. He had a short film career, much to his surprise, but he did reach new audiences. For a while after the war he was labeled a traitor by many Italians because of the Hitler-Mussolini connection, but eventually he cleared his name and resumed his career to critical success. However, when he felt his powers were starting to wane he decided to retire; his last performance was in Washington, DC, on May 25, 1955, after a professional career of nearly 41 years. He returned to Recanati and died at 67 years old in Rome on November 30, 1957.
biography.name: Beniamino Gigli

biography.bio: Käthe von Nagy wanted to get married at the age of 16, therefore, her parents put her in the Santa Chrisitana Convent, near Vienna. After that, she worked in her father's office and besides started to secretly write short stories for newspapers. In Budapest, she studied acting, dancing and singing, but her parents were not very happy. In 1926, she went to Berlin to make movies. She got a small part in the film _Männer von der Ehe (1927)_ and _Wien, du Stadt meiner Träume (1927)_ "Vienna, City of My Dreams". In 1930, she went into talkies with Der Andere (1930). She also made the French version of "Bomben auf Monte Carlo" (1931). In the German film, Anna Sten played the part. In 1938, she played in "Finale" ("Die Unruhigen Mädchen", "Les Sourires de Vienne"). After that she made 6 films in France. Her last one was Christine la fille du forestier (1952), alongside Johanna Matz. She died of cancer in Hollywood.
biography.name: Käthe von Nagy

biography.bio: Harald Paulsen was born on August 26, 1895 in Elmshorn, Germany. He was an actor and director, known for Ave Maria (1936), Les vaincus (1936) and Die zärtlichen Verwandten (1930). He was married to Hilla Höfer. He died on August 4, 1954 in Hamburg, West Germany.
biography.name: Harald Paulsen

biography.bio: Distinctive German star character actor, specialising in quaint or dyed-in-the-wool eccentrics, grumpy civil servants, pedantic school principals, doctors, head waiters and stuffy accountants. He studied under Louise Dumont and Gustav Lindemann and cut his acting teeth at the Düsseldorfer Schauspielhaus. Henckels was co-founder, and, from 1921, co-director of the Berlin Schlossparktheater. He was also a member of the ensemble of the Berlin Staatstheater from 1936 to 1945. He was discovered for the screen by silent star Henny Porten. After his debut appearance in this medium in 1921 he was rarely absent from films for the next four decades. His most fondly remembered role was that of the droll academic, Professor Bömmel, in the second filming of Ce diable de garçon (1944).
biography.name: Paul Henckels

biography.bio: Erna Berger was born on October 19, 1900 in Dresden, Germany. She was an actress, known for Ave Maria (1936), Der Wein und seine Lieder (1925) and Der Rosenkavalier (1949). She was married to Sverre Wiull. She died on June 14, 1990 in Essen, Germany.
biography.name: Erna Berger

biography.bio: Carl Auen was born on February 16, 1892 in Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. He was an actor, known for Das Geheimnis der sechs Spielkarten, 5. Teil - Herz König (1921), Lux, der König der Verbrecher (1929) and Das Geheimnis der sechs Spielkarten, 2. Teil - Pique Bube (1921). He died on June 23, 1972 in Lichterfelde, Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Carl Auen

biography.bio: Roly Bock is an assistant director and actor, known for Die Sonnenbrucks (1951), Mistress of the World (1960) and Conny und Peter machen Musik (1960).
biography.name: Roly Bock

biography.bio: Curt Cappi was born on January 8, 1878 in Weimar, Germany as Conrad Lehmann. He was an actor, known for Das Achtgroschenmädel, Teil 1 (1921), Die Brillantenmieze, 1. Teil (1921) and Schande (1922). He died in 1944 in Linz, Austria.
biography.name: Curt Cappi

biography.bio: Max Harry Ernst is an actor, known for One Too Many on Board (1935), Die letzten Vier von Santa Cruz (1936) and Drame à Canitoga (1939).
biography.name: Max Harry Ernst

biography.bio: Eva Genschow is an actress, known for Einmal werd' ich Dir gefallen (1938), The Divine Jetta (1937) and Contrebande (1936).
biography.name: Eva Genschow

biography.bio: Emmerich Hanus was born on August 24, 1884 in Vienna, Austria. He was a director and actor, known for Die Liebe der Maria Bonde (1918), Seine einzige Liebe (1947) and Le Moulin de la fortune (1947). He died on November 20, 1956 in Vienna.
biography.name: Emmerich Hanus

biography.bio: Hedi Heising is an actress, known for Es wird nichts so fein gesponnen (1937), Jeunes filles en bateau (1932) and Skandal um die Fledermaus (1936).
biography.name: Hedi Heising

biography.placeOfBirth: Breslau, Silesia, Germany [now Wroclaw, Dolnoslaskie, Poland]
biography.bio: Herbert Hübner was born on February 6, 1889 in Breslau, Silesia, Germany. He was an actor, known for The Haunted Castle (1960), L'auberge du Spessart (1958) and Louis II de Bavière (1955). He was married to Erna Grosse. He died on January 27, 1972 in Munich, Bavaria, West Germany.
biography.name: Herbert Hübner

biography.placeOfBirth: Metz, Lorraine, Germany [now Metz, Moselle, France]
biography.bio: Jutta Jol was born on February 4, 1896 in Metz, Lorraine, Germany. She was an actress, known for Un mari en vacances (1927), Wellen der Leidenschaft (1930) and Die Schmugglerbraut von Mallorca (1929). She died on October 26, 1981 in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Jutta Jol

biography.bio: Katrin Karina is an actress, known for Ave Maria (1936).
biography.name: Katrin Karina
